Keywords: Asgardian , Avengers , Deity , Warrior
Real Name: Thor Odinson
Special Powers
WHOSOEVER HOLDS THIS HAMMER, IF HE BE WORTHY, SHALL POSSESS THE POWER OF THOR: CLOSE/RANGE: If the Mjolnir special marker is not on the map, make a close/range attack targeting a single opposing character within range and line of fire, regardless of adjacency, modifying attack and damage +1. After resolutions, generate a Mjolnir special marker in a square adjacent to the hit target.
MJOLNIR: At the end of your turn, if the Mjolnir special marker wasn't generated this turn, draw a line of fire between it and Thor regardless of characters or terrain. If you do, remove the Mjolnir special marker from the map and destroy all pieces of blocking terrain along that line of fire then make a close attack targeting all opposing characters that occupy a square along that line of fire, regardless of adjacency.

November 26, 2022
Thor64
It's a free Close Attack at the end for Thor. If it was an action that gave Thor a token, the ability would have said "Power".
November 26, 2022
vectin
In the Mjolnir trait...they didn't spell it out that the hammer's return close attack is a power action. The language seems a little odd since it's dictating that the last action you make on your end of turn is this.
October 25, 2022
Thor64
Great Odin's beard! Have you guys even done the potential numbers because of his first trait "Whosoever be worthy?" His Attack and Damage values will be nothing short of insane. His first click could be a 13 Attack and his first three clicks could a whopping 6 Damage. SIX DAMAGE on the first three clicks?? And his lowest Damage would be a 4 on click six? And he doesn't have to worry about Adjacency?? Are you kidding me?? (and we haven't even talked about his second trait) Good lord, this LE card makes Thor a legit threat for a mere 125 points if the opposition doesn't target him quickly. I am soooo looking forward to re-using this old figure.

July 3, 2022
SuperClixer
To me the Legacy Cards are a bad idea if they are not boosting the combat values that need them, which are normally Attack and Defense Values, and although they made this Legacy Card boost AVs, it is the missing boost to Defense that makes it non-effective overall in making an older made figure compete with current modern day. I think they should just bag the whole Legacy Card concept, and remake the figure with same dial but with boosts to the Combat Values that need boosted, and with the same costume and pose in the new larger size sculpts.
